intro: Canthium violaceum, commonly known as purple rattlebox, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its showy, violet to purple flowers that bloom in late summer. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, a feature typical of the Malvaceae family. Canthium violaceum is often found in moist, sandy soils in open woodlands and along stream banks.
